sub_topic: Predicting the color of inorganic compounds
message_1: What is the predicted color of a cobalt(II) chloride solution when it is exposed to light?
message_2:
When a cobalt(II) chloride solution (CoCl₂) is exposed to light, it undergoes a process called photodissociation. This process causes the cobalt(II) chloride to change from its hydrated form (CoCl₂·6H₂O) to its anhydrous form (CoCl₂). The hydrated form of cobalt(II) chloride is typically pink or rose-colored, while the anhydrous form is blue. 

So, when a cobalt(II) chloride solution is exposed to light, the predicted color change would be from pink/rose to blue.
